abstract: The family that controls Dow Jones & Company has rejected a proposed plan prepared by its lawyers, asking them instead to seek stronger guarantees of editorial independence as a condition of selling the company to Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: The family that controls Dow Jones & Company has rejected a proposed plan prepared by its lawyers, asking them instead to seek stronger guarantees of editorial independence as a condition of selling the company to Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation, The New York Times reported.

headline.main: Family Seeks Assurances on Protecting Dow Integrity
